title: Conor McGregor calls out 50 Cent for celebrity fight over Instagram jibes
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Conor McGregor has called out 50 Cent for a celebrity fight in response to the rappers social media posts making fun of him.

The UFC star recently announced the date of his impending return to the Octagon after over a year out.

McGregor was beaten by Khabib Nurmagomedov in October last year, and faced Fifty's pal Floyd Mayweather in a boxing match before that.

The 'Get Rich or Die Trying' artist was involved in the pre-fight build-up to the McGregor-Mayweather clash, but has since irked the Irishman with his posts on Instagram .

After the Dubliner attacked a bus filled with UFC fights, including Nurmagomedov, Fifty posted a mocked-up picture of McGregor on pop star Britney Spears' body when she lashed out at a car with an umbrella back in 2007.

(Image: Getty Images)

He captioned the post: "Is that you Britney?"

And McGregor now wants revenge, admitting at his latest press conference in Moscow: "I’d have to probably say 50 Cent, I’d like to fight him.

"Throughout the course of the [Floyd] Mayweather build-up I used him as a tool, a promotional tool on the free also, I knew he was linked to Floyd so I tied him in also and he responded big time and we capitalised on that audience so I was very thankful.

"But then after that he began a little tirade against me on social media, particularly Instagram where he’d make these memes about me constantly.

(Image: 50Cent/Instagram)

"Every time I’d go onto the internet I’d see 50 Cent had posted up some new stupid meme and I wrote one of the memes - ‘old man on the internet making memes’ and then he blocked me.

"So he’s had to block me, and I still see sometimes, I still get tagged in - other people saying he’s saying this and his saying that.

"So I’d like to have a knock-off with 50 yeah, so if you’re listening 50 - let’s get it going bud."

(Image: REUTERS)

The musician - real name Curtis Jackson - stepped into boxing promotion in 2012 when he founded his company The Money Team, before briefly teaming up with Mayweather.

There is plenty of hype around celebrity fights at present, with Youtube stars Logan Paul and KSI set to face-off in Los Angeles in just under a fortnight.

Whether Jackson would be willing to step between the ropes himself would be a different matter, but McGregor also had time to take a swipe at Mayweather.

"I went into another mans sport. The supposed best and faced him at his skill set," McGregor said.

"It was supposed to be reciprocated. I would box him, he would fight me, but it didn't turn out that way."

Mayweather won the boxing match between the pair with an 11th round stoppage, while McGregor has since returned to mixed martial arts.

He is set to make his eagerly-awaited return on January 18, but an opponent is yet to be confirmed.
description: The rapper has hit out at McGregor on social media over his bus attack and loss to Khabib Nurmagomedov
